definition: male/staminate/grand/imposing/powerful/mighty/person or state having great power and influence

sentences.english: He gets up at the crow of the rooster every day.
sentences.chinese: 天亮了，我聽到從某處傳來雄雞的報曉聲。

sentences.english: It was dawn, and I could hear a cock crowing somewhere.
sentences.chinese: 天亮了，我聽到從某處傳來雄雞的報曉聲。

sentences.english: France's president held a crisis meeting in response to the defeat of Les Bleus.
sentences.chinese: 法國總統也就高盧雄雞的失利召開了緊急會議。

sentences.english: Such as a magical tree, a golden rooster, and other mythical items.
sentences.chinese: 一課神奇的樹，一隻金色的雄雞和其它一些寶物。

sentences.english: The Chanticleer was eventually sold to the Customs Office in 1833.
sentences.chinese: 雄雞號最終在1833年被賣給海關。

sentences.english: “A million roosters cross the mighty Yangzi” was the expression of the day.
sentences.chinese: “百萬雄雞過長江”可以用於形容這一場景。

sentences.english: Nationalism is a silly cock crow on it own dunghill.
sentences.chinese: 民族主義，是在自己的小天地裏自鳴得意的雄雞。

sentences.english: The new cock was jealous and immediately chased the original old cock furiously.
sentences.chinese: 這新的雄雞醋味很大，馬上窮追原來那隻老雄雞？

sentences.english: The new cock was jealous and immediately chased the original old cock furiously.
sentences.chinese: 這新的雄雞醋味很大，馬上窮追原來那隻老雄雞？

sentences.english: The long crow of rooster split the gray morning sky.
sentences.chinese: 一隻雄雞引吮長鳴，驚破了黎明時的蒼穹。

sentences.english: But once the cock sing the world white, the people get up the stem to live after hear.
sentences.chinese: 但是雄雞一唱天下白，人們聽後就起牀幹活。

sentences.english: Underglaze black color cock pattern vase.
The cock crows and the dawn chorus begins.
The cock crows in the farmyard.
The cock clapped his wings and crowed.

definition: to start practicing at the first crow of the cock (idiom)/to be diligent in one's studies
the country prospers, the people at peace (idiom); peace and prosperity
to accept a life of ease/to enjoy a comfortable retirement
to inscribe a poem (often, composed on the spot) on a painting, fan or ceramic bowl etc as a work of calligraphy/an inscribed poem
(bird species of China) Eurasian magpie (Pica pica)
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
